interventions.title: Use natural daylight (e.g. shades up) during the day

calculation.formula_note: hours_off * beds * 365 * kWh_per_bed_hour * local grid factor

ui.summary: Daylight harvesting: turn off lights when sunlit.
ui.details_markdown: Preserving day-night cycles also reduces delirium, shortening hospital LOS.

interventions.title: Dim ICU lighting at night

calculation.formula_note: hours * beds * 365 * kWh_per_bed_hour * grid_factor

ui.summary: Reduce lighting hours at night with dimming/controls.
ui.details_markdown: Preserving day-night cycles also reduces delirium, shortening hospital LOS. (Assumes linear kWh reduction with hours off.)

interventions.title: Upgrade from incandescent/halogen to modern LED lighting

calculation.formula_note: LED retrofit reduces lighting energy use by ~70–80 %, approximated as 15 % of total lighting category.

ui.summary: LED retrofit reduces lighting electricity substantially.
ui.details_markdown: Binary toggle: enables ~15% reduction in lighting energy use (≈70% lamp efficiency gain).

interventions.title: Reduce paper printouts and forms

calculation.formula_note: Digital workflows cut paper procurement and waste

ui.summary: Go digital for charts and orders.
ui.details_markdown: Approx 1–2 % procurement savings; consistent with Green ICU initiatives.

interventions.title: Incentivize low‑carbon staff commuting (carpool, bike, transit)

calculation.formula_note: Proxy: small reduction in procurement/ops per % staff adopting low‑carbon commute.

ui.summary: Offer incentives, secure bike parking, transit benefits, and carpool matching.
ui.details_markdown: Slider approximates the share of staff trips shifted. Applies a small proxy reduction to procurement.

references.label: Employer TDM Toolkit (Best Workplaces for Commuters)
Parking Cash Out: Implementing Commuter Benefits

interventions.title: Low-emission deliveries (EV, bike, consolidated routes)

calculation.formula_note: Cleaner last-mile logistics modestly lower upstream procurement footprint; scaled to adoption.

ui.summary: Shift suppliers and internal logistics to low/zero-emission delivery modes.
ui.details_markdown: Includes EV vans, e-cargo bikes, and route consolidation for hospital deliveries.

interventions.title: Offset electricity with onsite renewables (e.g., solar)

calculation.formula_note: Reduce Energy/HVAC slice by the percent of electricity offset.

ui.summary: Install photovoltaics or other on-site renewables to offset grid electricity.
ui.details_markdown: Slider represents the fraction of ICU electricity demand offset annually.

interventions.title: HVAC: Demand-controlled or variable-air-volume ventilation

baseline_control.label: Do all ICU rooms have fixed high ventilation at baseline?

calculation.formula_note: Reduce HVAC energy proportionally to slider (1% per %).

ui.summary: Only heat/cool rooms that are occupied. Matching ventilation to occupancy/CO₂ can save fan & heating/cooling energy.
ui.details_markdown: Sensors/Controls and policy changes required.

interventions.title: HVAC: Relax temperature set-point by 1–3°C

baseline_control.label: Is a strict 21 °C temperature maintained year-round?

calculation.formula_note: ≈3% HVAC energy reduction per °C set-point moderation (US DOE)

ui.summary: Each °C of wider tolerance saves ~3% of HVAC energy use.
ui.details_markdown: (Linear scaling: 1 °C ≈ 3 %, 3 °C ≈ 9 %. Based on DOE/ASHRAE data.)

interventions.title: HVAC: High-efficiency plant equipment upgrades

baseline_control.label: Is the central plant/HVAC outdated (Common if build before 2000)

calculation.formula_note: Slider directly sets % reduction to the energy/HVAC category from high-efficiency retrofits.

ui.summary: Upgrade chillers, boilers, AHUs, and controls to high-efficiency/ENERGY STAR.
ui.details_markdown: Commissioning and high-efficiency equipment can deliver sustained energy savings in hospitals.

references.label: ENERGY STAR for Healthcare: Energy solutions
ASHRAE: Hospital energy efficiency case examples

interventions.title: HVAC: Heat recovery for ventilation/chilled-water (ERV/HRCH)

baseline_control.label: Does the central plant use heat recovery at baseline? (Uncommon if HVAC plant older than the 2010s)

calculation.formula_note: Slider directly sets % reduction for energy/HVAC via heat recovery systems.

ui.summary: Recover heat from exhaust air or use heat-recovery chillers.
ui.details_markdown: ERV/HRCH systems can cut HVAC energy when properly engineered and operated.

references.label: DOE Better Buildings: Heat recovery chiller case study
NREL: Hospital heat recovery and energy efficiency case studies

interventions.title: Improve building insulation

baseline_control.label: Suboptimal insulation baseline? (Common if hospital built before 1980s)

calculation.formula_note: Reduced HVAC loads via insulation upgrades

ui.summary: Improved insulation/air sealing lowers heating and cooling demand.
ui.details_markdown: Commissioning + envelope improvements.

interventions.title: Use biohazard waste only for visibly blood-soiled items

baseline_control.label: Are biohazard bags used for most waste?

calculation.formula_note: Better segregation reduces red-bag volume and treatment emissions

ui.summary: Red biohazard bags are transported to special facilities and incinerated. Use red-bags only when necessary.
ui.details_markdown: Training and audits can maintain compliance and reduce red-bag waste by up to 20%.

references.label: Sherman et al 2020 J Hosp Med
references.url: Sherman et al 2020 J Hosp Med

interventions.title: Plastics recycling program (clinical & non-clinical)

calculation.formula_note: Increase recycling diverts plastics from landfill/incineration; scaled reduction applied to waste category.

ui.summary: Implement plastics segregation & recycling streams.
ui.details_markdown: Set up clean plastics collection, train staff, and audit streams to divert plastics from red-bag and landfill.

interventions.title: Stock fewer single-use items inside patient rooms

baseline_control.label: Are large amounts of single-use items stocked in each room?

calculation.formula_note: Reduces unused disposables discarded after each patient

ui.summary: Keep supply carts outside patient rooms.
ui.details_markdown: Common Green ICU recommendation; 2–5 % procurement savings.

interventions.title: Switch to reusable isolation gowns

calculation.formula_note: Reduce procurement slice proportional to reduction in disposables

ui.summary: Textile gowns laundered & reused; lower embodied carbon.
ui.details_markdown: Assumes infrastructure supports reusable workflow.

interventions.title: Repair/maintain washers/dryers/blanket warmers

baseline_control.label: Is there a repair/upgrade program in place for washers/dryers/blanket warmers?

calculation.formula_note: Longer lifespan lowers embodied carbon per year of use

ui.summary: Maintain and refurbish equipment instead of replacing.
ui.details_markdown: (Approx 5 % procurement CO₂ savings; circular-economy principles.)

interventions.title: Reduce default linen and towel par levels

calculation.formula_note: Reduced laundry and textile procurement energy/water by fewer items per patient.

ui.summary: Reduce baseline linen/towel stock to decrease laundering.
ui.details_markdown: Baseline laundry ~1.5–2 kg CO₂e/kg; par cut 15–40% saves 3–15 tCO₂e/yr (Vozzola 2020).

references.label: Vozzola E et al. J Healthc Eng 2020
references.url: Vozzola E et al. J Healthc Eng 2020

interventions.title: Avoid unnecessary ICU admissions through accurate triage

baseline_control.label: Are borderline cases routinely admitted to ICU? (Common if no step-down unit)

calculation.formula_note: Reducing inappropriate ICU use lowers total bed-days and energy demand

ui.summary: Smarter triage reduces overall ICU bed-days.
ui.details_markdown: Based on estimates that 5–10% of ICU admissions are potentially avoidable (Mowatt et al., 2023).

references.label: Mowatt et al., 2023 J Intensive Care Soc 24(9):463–474
references.url: Mowatt et al., 2023 J Intensive Care Soc 24(9):463–474

interventions.title: Discuss goals of care on all admissions

baseline_control.label: Are goals-of-care discussed on admission with all patients?

calculation.formula_note: Proxy: lower low-value utilization reduces resource use

ui.summary: Earlier alignment may avert non-beneficial interventions that are not aligned with patient/family wishes.
ui.details_markdown: (Hard to quantify precisely; conservative 5% proxy.)

interventions.title: Implement ABCDEF (ICU Liberation) bundle

calculation.formula_note: Reduced ICU LOS and ventilator time lowers energy and consumables footprint; ~10% overall ICU GHG reduction at full adoption.

ui.summary: Comprehensive ICU liberation bundle reduces ventilator days and ICU length of stay.
ui.details_markdown: Typical reduction ≈0.8 vent days + 1 ICU day/patient (Balas 2014; Pun 2019). Estimated 8–12% total ICU GHG reduction.

references.label: Balas MC et al. Crit Care Med 2014
references.url: Balas MC et al. Crit Care Med 2014

references.label: Pun BT et al. Crit Care Med 2019
references.url: Pun BT et al. Crit Care Med 2019

references.label: Barnes-Daly MA et al. BMJ Qual Saf 2018
references.url: Barnes-Daly MA et al. BMJ Qual Saf 2018

interventions.title: Use peripheral vasopressors when safe instead of central lines

baseline_control.label: Are central lines used for patients on low dose vasopressors?

calculation.formula_note: Reduce central line kits/consumables & complications

ui.summary: Peripheral use (when appropriate) lowers device consumption. Also reduces CLABSI risk.
ui.details_markdown: Clinical safety first; small but real savings.

interventions.title: Avoid over-investigation and routine testing (e.g. daily CXR)

calculation.formula_note: Less single-use consumables, syringes, and reagents

ui.summary: Eliminate routine daily labs & imaging without indication. (e.g. “daily CXR” order)
ui.details_markdown: Consistent with ‘Choosing Wisely’ ICU recommendations.

references.label: Mowatt et al., 2023 J Intensive Care Soc
references.url: Mowatt et al., 2023 J Intensive Care Soc

interventions.title: CRRT stewardship (reduce unnecessary hours)

calculation.formula_note: Δhours * kgCO2e/hour * patient-days / 1000

ui.summary: Targeted CRRT utilization to clinical indications.
ui.details_markdown: Local stewardship program reduces running hours.

interventions.title: Early palliative care consults for high-risk ICU patients

baseline_control.label: Eligible admissions receiving early palliative consult

calculation.formula_note: Reduces non-beneficial interventions and ICU LOS modestly; proxy 5–10% resource reduction.

ui.summary: Early palliative input aligns care and may shorten ICU stays.
ui.details_markdown: Average 0.3–0.6 day LOS reduction/patient; 5–20 tCO₂e/yr savings.

references.label: Temel JS et al. N Engl J Med 2010
references.url: Temel JS et al. N Engl J Med 2010

references.label: Khandelwal N et al. Crit Care Med 2015
references.url: Khandelwal N et al. Crit Care Med 2015

interventions.title: Use telepresence for meetings and follow-up when possible

baseline_control.label: Are the majority of meetings/consultation done face to face?

calculation.formula_note: Avoids vehicle emissions from staff/patient travel

ui.summary: Teleconsults and family video visits replace travel.
ui.details_markdown: (Estimated to reduce travel-related CO₂ ≈ 0.1–0.3 t per ICU bed year.)

interventions.title: Increase plant-based foods for patients and staff

calculation.formula_note: Reduce procurement proportional to plant-based adoption

ui.summary: Shift menus for patients/staff toward plant-forward options.
ui.details_markdown: Plant-based diets cut agricultural methane and land-use emissions.

interventions.title: Seasonal menu planning (local & in-season foods)

calculation.formula_note: Seasonal/local sourcing can lower upstream emissions; conservative scaled reduction applied to procurement.

ui.summary: Shift menus toward in-season produce from local suppliers.
ui.details_markdown: Seasonal planning reduces cold-chain intensity and can support lower-carbon choices.

references.label: WRI Cool Food Pledge Playbook (menu strategies)

interventions.title: Increase local/sustainable food sourcing

calculation.formula_note: Small procurement reduction proxy with increased local/sustainable sourcing.

ui.summary: Source more food locally and sustainably to reduce supply‑chain emissions and support regional producers.
ui.details_markdown: Proxy reduction to procurement; pair with plant‑forward menu strategies for bigger impact.

references.label: Health Care Without Harm — Healthy Food

interventions.title: Switch eligible IV medications to oral

baseline_control.label: % PO eligible meds given IV as baseline?

calculation.formula_note: % reduction applied to pharma category proportional to adoption

ui.summary: Oral formulations often have lower packaging and prep load. Also reduces risk of CLABSI.
ui.details_markdown: Scope to meds with equivalent efficacy/bioavailability.

interventions.title: Avoid routine prophylaxis (e.g., PPIs) for low-risk patients

baseline_control.label: Is GI prophylaxis routinely used in low risk patients?

calculation.formula_note: Less unnecessary medication use → smaller pharmaceutical footprint

ui.summary: Target GI prophylaxis only to those who benefit. Also reduces risk of aspiration pneumonia.
ui.details_markdown: Conservative estimate ≈3% pharma reduction; Mowatt et al., 2023.

references.label: Mowatt et al., 2023 J Intensive Care Soc
references.url: Mowatt et al., 2023 J Intensive Care Soc

interventions.title: Avoid aggressive electrolyte replacement when not indicated

calculation.formula_note: Protocolization reduces unnecessary pharmacy use; conservative reduction applied.

ui.summary: Use protocols and narrower lab thresholds to limit unnecessary electrolyte replacement.
ui.details_markdown: For most patients tight electrolyte repletion does not improve outcomes. (Conservative estimate of reduced pharmacy resource use.)

references.label: Behavioural patterns of electrolyte repletion in intensive care units (2018)

interventions.title: Antibiotic stewardship and early de-escalation

calculation.formula_note: Fewer doses. Less IV prep/infusion consumables and shorter LOS reduce emissions.

ui.summary: Antibiotic stewardship reduces unnecessary therapy and IV resource use.
ui.details_markdown: 10–25% reduction in DOT yields 2–10 tCO₂e/yr savings (IDSA/SHEA 2023).

references.label: Barlam TF et al. Clin Infect Dis 2016
references.url: Barlam TF et al. Clin Infect Dis 2016

references.label: CDC Core Elements of Hospital Antibiotic Stewardship 2019
references.url: CDC Core Elements of Hospital Antibiotic Stewardship 2019

interventions.title: Eliminate N₂O use

calculation.formula_note: annual_kg * GWP100 / 1000

ui.summary: Stop N₂O in ICU; use alternatives for sedation.
ui.details_markdown: High GWP gas; common target for elimination.

interventions.title: Eliminate desflurane

calculation.formula_note: minutes*ml/min*density → kg * GWP100 / 1000

ui.summary: Remove desflurane from hospital formulary. It is by far the worst greenhouse gas.
ui.details_markdown: Use TIVA or sevoflurane in appropriate settings.

interventions.title: Switch MDI to nebulizer whenever clinically appropriate

calculation.formula_note: Δpuffs * kg/puff * patient-days / 1000

ui.summary: The propellants used in MDIs (e.g. HFA) are a significant greenhouse gas. One MDI is equivalent to driving 200 km.
ui.details_markdown: Where safe & effective, prefer nebulizers or DPIs.

references.label: Weppner WG et al, JAMA. 2025. doi:10.1001/jama.2025.15638
references.url: Weppner WG et al, JAMA. 2025. doi:10.1001/jama.2025.15638

interventions.title: Shift to reusable bronchoscopes

baseline_control.label: % of bronchoscopes performed using reusable bronchoscopes at baseline

calculation.formula_note: Simplified % reduction of procurement slice

ui.summary: Reusable devices reduce manufacturing/waste impacts.
ui.details_markdown: (Assumes linear savings with % reusable.)

interventions.title: Eliminate disposable stethoscopes (clean reusable stethoscopes instead)

baseline_control.label: % of ICU rooms that use reusable stethoscopes at baseline

calculation.formula_note: Assume linear reduction in procurement with % shift to reusable

ui.summary: Use reusable stethoscopes to cut single-use plastics/metals.
ui.details_markdown: Small but simple change; savings scale with adoption.

interventions.title: Titrate oxygen to target range (avoid over-oxygenation)

baseline_control.label: Is excess O₂ used above a physiologic target? What percent excess?

calculation.formula_note: ~1–3 % GHG reduction per 10 % O₂ flow reduction; linear scaling

ui.summary: Titrate FiO₂ to target; reduces industrial oxygen use.
ui.details_markdown: (Linear effect: 10 % less flow ≈ 2 % GHG savings from oxygen production plant.)
